auto_tune_xgboost

Source: R/tune_xgboost.R
auto_tune_xgboost.Rd

Automatically tunes an xgboost model using bayesian optimization

auto_tune_xgboost(
  .data,
  formula,
  event_level = c("first", "second"),
  n_fold = 5,
  seed = 1,
  n_iter = 100,
  save_output = FALSE,
  parallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

.data

dataframe

formula

formula

event_level

for binary classification, which factor level is the positive class. specify "second" for second level

n_fold

integer. n folds in resamples

seed

seed

n_iter

n iterations for tuning

save_output

FASLE. If set to TRUE will write the output as an rds file

parallel

FALSE. If set to TRUE, will enable parallel processing

Value

workflow object

Examples


if(FALSE){


iris %>%
 framecleaner::create_dummies() -> iris1

iris1 %>%
 tidy_formula(target = Petal.Length) -> petal_form

iris1 %>%
 rsample::initial_split() -> iris_split

iris_split %>%
 rsample::analysis() -> iris_train

iris_split %>%
 rsample::assessment() -> iris_val

iris_train %>%
 auto_tune_xgboost(formula = petal_form, n_iter = 10, parallel = TRUE) -> xgb_tuned

xgb_tuned %>%
 fit(iris_train) %>%
 hardhat::extract_fit_engine() -> xgb_tuned_fit

xgb_tuned_fit %>%
 tidy_predict(newdata = iris_val, form = petal_form) -> iris_val1


}
